popularityCurve.label: the plan b otc switch application was the only one during this period that was not approved after the advisory committees recommended approval there are no age-related marketing restrictions for any prescription or otc contraceptives that fda has approved and fda has not required pediatric studies for them fda identified no issues that would require age-related restrictions in the review of the original prescription plan b gao found that high-level management's involvement for the plan b decision was unusual for an otc switch application and fda officials gave gao conflicting accounts about when they believed the decision was made
